body.name: PCCOOLER RZ400 CPU Cooler TDP 180W CPU Air Cooler Single Tower CPU Fan 4 HeatPipe CPU Cooling System Three Modes PWM Silent Fans, Easy Install Air Cooler for Intel LGA 115X/1200/1700,AMD AM4/AM5,BK
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 14 hrs 8 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 11 hrs 38 mins
features: 【Three-Speed Control Fans】RZ400 CPU Cooler is equipped with high-performance cooling fans,has three speed regulation modes to meet the cooling requirements of CPU in different scenarios.The maximum speed of the strongest mode can reach 2200RPM,the air volume up to 86.73 CFM.The cooling fan is equipped with shock-absorbing rubber pad, which can also effectively reduce the noise at high speed, achieving a perfect balance between performance and noise.

【Innovative Fin Array Design 】Incorporating the Family Design Language, the streamlined design of radiator adheres more closely to aerodynamic principles.It not only improve visual appeal, but also increases fin surface area to improve heat dissipation efficiency.

【Φ4*6MM Heatpipe 】Featuring a reverse gravity heatpipe design, the heat dissipation for CPU is faster and more stable. Meanwhile, it's installed horizontally, vertically or at any other angle, the cooling performance is not affected and consistently provides excellent heat dissipation efficiency.

【Dual Platform Compatibility】RZ400 CPU air cooler overall height of the product is 157.5MM, which is compatible for Intel LGA 115X/1200/1700,AMD AM4/AM5.Its installation is very convenient, the package provide dual-platform installation tools, please confirm before installation

【New Impression of CPS Series】PCCOOLER launched the CPS series based on the changing usage needs of computer gamers. This is a new series!Throwing away the PCCOOLER old brand impression, series products use high-end design and extremely high performance, only hope to meet the more advanced needs of computer gamers.

【3 Year Warranty】PCCOOLER provides comprehensive pre-sales and after-sales service! PCCOOLER has a strong R&D team, RZ400 series products provide 3-year warranty service, when you purchase and use any questions, you can contact us at any time through the store mailbox, we will do our best to solve your problem

【Metallic Top Protective Cover】RZ400 CPU air cooler crafted from aerospace-grade aluminum alloy using CNC integral molding technology, the surface is delicately sprayed for a fine finish, delivering a pleasant visual and tactile experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Extreme cooling and quality at its finest, I was thoroughly impressed!
reviews.reviewText: When building a PC your budget can get out of control fast, and one area it can be tempting to cut back is on the CPU cooler. Certainly, a premium model can't make that much of a difference, can it? Well, I'm here to tell you that it certainly CAN, and when you think about, the CPU is probably the most expensive part in your whole build- it deserves the best protection you can give it!This is BIG and HEAVY and made of the most solid, impressive metal I have seen. There is no cheap aluminum that bends when you press on the grills, or tiny screw threads that strip and flake here, this is tough like a TANK! The CPU contact face is solid copper, not just striped copper where the cooling pipes cross over it. The thick adjustable back plate locks down onto the CPU's own metal backing firmly and pulls additional heat off of the back, which is a lot more powerful than a stock fan with pegs that pinch in from above and offer nothing extra for the back of the processor. What really stands out for me is that once the cooler is on, you can remove the actual heat sink and access the CPU socket for upgrades later on WITHOUT having to flip your case over and remove the back plate! Just unscrew the two screws that hold the heat sink onto the mounting poles, take them off, and the CPU socket/tray is right there, unobstructed, for a quick upgrade that doesn't require removing the back plate or possibly having to take out the entire motherboard to get to it! I absolutely LOVE that!The included dual fans link together for using the same socket, and they were very quiet, but also able to ramp up high when pushed to do so. Even at the highest I could push them, though, I never felt that they added any more noise than the fans in the case itself already did, those fans were almost always louder than these. The included thermal paste is great, I love that they give you a real squeeze tube and not a one-time-use plastic baggie you have to tear and squeeze the paste out of. This is much easier to apply, and you can save some for if you do an upgrade later on and need to reapply it.The RAM clearance is not just great, it is also somewhat adjustable by mounting the first fan even higher up on the grill if you need even MORE space above the RAM. This can easily fit a tall RAM heat sink, even if it is fairly close to the CPU, as was the case in my PC. I'm really amazed at how something so huge in itself also stays out of the way of everything else in the case.Cooling was simply outstanding, this dropped my temps by almost 20C at all times, and 40C from maximum CPU stress, versus the stock fan- it was just crazy! At 265W TDP, this is frankly overkill on all but the most intense builds, and easily accommodates my generic ratio-step overclocking without even breaking a sweat.This is without a doubt the finest, most rugged CPU cooler I have ever had the pleasure to own, and it install and removes easily for nearly effortless CPU upgrades. There is not a single bad thing I can say, this met and even exceeded almost every expectation I had, and I enthusiastically give it a full 5-stars!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: At the $75 price point, this cooler has a bunch of competition, even from big names like the brown and other lighter brown company. So why does this cooler deserve it's 5/5 stars? I literally cannot tell you. This cooler performed great, I've had large air coolers like this from many different brands, noctua, deepcool, Thermaltake, thermalright, Id-cooling, and I'll be honest, All these large coolers perform really close to each other. I mean at most I think I've seen 5 degree differences on some of these coolers. I currently have 5 builds and I have used all these coolers so I speak from real experience. So why choose this PCcooler one? Well I still can't say. It's got the best kind of mounting system, but then again several of the brands I listed also use the same type of mounting system too... The fans are quiet and perform well, but if you go brown you can get some even quieter fans.... But hey maybe it really is a good thing that this cooler just performs well enough that it doesn't become the odd one out of the bunch. PCcooler has been around for a short while, but my experience with them has been pretty good. I remember their RGB ring type fans were really popular for a while since they were so quiet and had RGB when that was really hard to find in a cheap price range. So maybe give this cooler a shot to see how far a smaller cooler company has gotten. I'm pretty impressed and happy with this cooler and I think you would be too. Fair warning though, I don't have a CPU that pushes all these coolers to their limits, just a 12700k. Maybe in the upper limits and you're hunting every degree you can, does it really make a difference. $75 I say its worth it, but shop around and choose by a design you like rather than a name. 5/5 stars!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install and works well.
reviews.reviewText: I had to replace the cooler on my PC because my old one wasn't working properly. It was easy to install on a Ryzen chip/motherboard. It came with a fan, two mounting clips, and a tube of their own brand of thermal paste. The thermal paste seemed a bit less liquidy than some others I've used but it worked well and my CPU temperatures remain well within normal range. It only comes with 2 fan mounting clips, so if you want to use 2 fans you'll need to get additional clips. The fan can be mounted on either side and it has arrows on the side indicating the airflow direction.The cooler is nice and solid. It's pretty unassuming except for the one corner where there's a triangle pattern and a little orange sliver that doesn't light up but refracts any light it receives. With enough light in the case, it looks like it lights up and with very little light you basically can't even see it. It was solidly black, with no chips and no bent fins.I've been running it for days with no issues and good temperatures (Ryzen 7 5800) when playing games. It also runs surprisingly quietly for an air cooler, no louder than the AIO it replaced. The cost seems reasonable for a nice hefty air cooler that works well. I just wish they'd included extra mounting clips in case you wanted to put fans on both sides of the cooler. Otherwise, it's perfect.

I tested this CPS cooler against my be quiet! Dark Rock 4 to see how it would perform. The CPU is a Core i9-10900 on an ASUS Maximus XIII Hero motherboard. My expectation was that, given its size (smaller tower and fan than the Dark Rock), the CPU would probably run a couple degrees hotter using the CPS K4. That would have been fine actually given that this cooler is about half the cost of the Dark Rock. To my surprise, the CPS K4 performed BETTER! The results are below:Cinebench R23 multicore score:CPS K4: 14512Dark Rock: 14293Cinebench R23 single core score:CPS K4: 1292Dark Rock: 1293CPU package temp - Celsius (while running the tests):CPS K4: 30 (idle) to 89 (full load)Dark Rock: 32 (idle) to 92 (full load)Core temps - Celsius (while running the tests - average):CPS K4: 28 (idle) to 89 (full load)Dark Rock: 30 (idle) to 92 (full load)I also got numbers for Cinebench 2024 and they showed the same pattern: The CPS K4 has the CPU consistently 3-4 degrees cooler than the Dark Rock. Add that to the fact that the CPS K4 is priced at almost half of what I paid for the Dark Rock, and you have a good cooler choice right here.I really like the look of this cooler as well and the fact that it takes up less space than the Dark Rock is a bonus. The installation instructions in the manual are clear and easy to follow. The fan is indeed 130mm (not a size I commonly see, usually it's either 120mm or 140mm) and it does a great job at moving air. The only small down side is that the fan gets quite loud when at full speed. Given its cooling performance though, I'm quite ok with that.This cooler definitely gets an easy recommend from me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great alternative to more expensive brands
reviews.reviewText: I was wanting a bit more cooling for my CPU (Originally used the wraith one that came with my 5600) & this one seemed to fit the bill nicely.It fit into my case well, easy to install, and looks really nice with my all black build. I was also pleasantly surprised with the fan's performance to noise & it is more than enough to keep my 5600 in check.The one thing to keep in mind is that if you have a higher performance CPU, stepping up to one with 5+ heat pipes (or in some instances with the newer intel CPUs, ones designed to target the correct location of heat on the chip) may be better than this one.But for 90% of other applications, I would strongly recommend this cooler,

Pour info, il s'agit du nouveau ventirad K4 en version noire (existe aussi en blanc.).Pour ceux qui veulent un ordinateur plus silencieux ou qui ont tendance à faire chauffer leur processeur, c'est la nuit et le jour en comparaison avec une installation d'origine. Et pour ceux qui n'y connaissent pas grand-chose, c'est hyper facile à installer.Il est utilisable sur les Intel LGA 115x / 1200 / 1700 et les AMD AM4 et AM5 , kit de montage et pâte thermique (version GT3) sont fournis.4 Heat pipe en contact direct avec la plaque du processeur, 60 W par tuyau, soit 240 W avec un poids très raisonnable , 614 g avec le ventilateur , donc contrainte tres raisonnable sur la carte mère. Il utilise aussi une technologie antigravité, ce qui veut dire qu'on peut l'installer dans toutes les positions et que ça n'affectera pas ses performances.Il est fourni avec son ventilateur 130 mm (PWM 4 pin) (facilement démontable pour dépoussiérage) dont la vitesse peut varier de 400 à 1600 tours/minute.

reviews.reviewTitle: Large 130mm cooling solution for your CPU
reviews.reviewText: Its big, bigger than I expected, Ia bit bigger and I couldn't close my case's cover. Its powerful enough to get the job done on my 12th gen i5-12400 and keep it much cooler than the stock fan. It comes with everything you need to install it including some thermal paste. Its a little bit louder than the 120mm fan that I had before but its a 130mm fan and the performance are much better. Rubber pads on the fan keeps the vibration sound down. The white model looks great. I like it, I recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Works a charm and fantastic value for money
reviews.reviewText: The dual-tower design of this CPU air cooling system sets it apart, offering enhanced heat dissipation for optimal performance. Its robust construction ensures efficient heat transfer, contributing to a cooler and more stable system. Installation is straightforward, and the quiet operation makes it an excellent choice for users seeking a balance between cooling power and low noise levels. Overall, a reliable and ideal value for money solution for keeping your CPU temperatures in check.
